content.description:
Begins at 2 and 9 o'clock on the "pizza pie slice" on the left about 23 feet into the mouth of the cave. Lots of opportunities to cross your limbs and work your feet. Crux move is right in the middle on the obvious sloper rail. Ends at the cave entrance or as far out as you'd like to venture.

This climbs great from right to left but I'm sure is un the other way as well. Enjoy!

4/20/2017 EDIT - Went back yesterday to give the problem a go from left to right and it had decent flow. Right to Left is cleaner but if you wanted a solid work-out you could do the whole loop :)
content.protection: A crash pad or two for some high foot moves. There are a few small boulders in the fall zone but nothing to stress about. Entire climb is very close to the ground.
content.location: About 5 minutes walking up the very obvious and beaten dirt path from street or lot parking in Griffith Park on Canyon Drive. Doesn't get any easier than this to find :) Parking gets real nasty after 10am-ish on the weekends, so keep that in mind.

content.description: Start on a good right hand and a high left pocket.  Then a strenuous move up to a big left hand.  Then right hand up to a sharp crimp below and right of the big left.  From there it's two big jugs up to the knob hanging down from the roof of the cave.  There's a shitty crimp on the top side of it, and not much else.  Hang on for as long as you can, then aim for you pad!
content.location: walking through the cave from the trail entrance, it's on the right hand side about twenty feet from the cave's exit, just before the smaller tunnel that leads off to the right.
